data.name: section1_content1
data.value: The Double Master’s Degree Programme goal is to form specialists in the field of Mechanical Engineering, to foster mobility of the students and academics, and to offer the students an international experience and exposure to both Ukrainian and Polish learning values.

data.name: section1_content2
data.value: The programme established cooperation in the area of student exchange offering students an opportunity to obtain two degrees in Mechanical Engineering according to the programs of both universities:

data.name: section1_content3
data.value: diploma of Master of Science Engineer of PUT

data.name: section1_content4
data.value: diploma of Master of Science in “Mechanical Engineering” of Igor Sikorsky KPI

data.name: section1_content5
data.value: Programme's History

data.name: section1_content6
data.value:
• April 6-7, 2017 - signing an agreement of understanding - between Igor Sikorsky KPI and Poznan University of Technology during the meeting of Rectors of higher technical educational institutions of Ukraine and Poland
  • June 27, 2017 - beginning the creation of the Double Master's Degree Programme
  • July 29, 2017 - agreed the curricula of specialties
  • August 20, 2017 - the Agreement and Regulations for the Programme are prepared
  • August 29, 2017 - signing by the Rectors of Igor Sikorsky KPI and Poznan University of Technology agreements on the Double Master's Degree Programme at the Center for Culture and Arts (Kyiv)
  • February 17, 2018 - the first five students of Double Master's Degree Programme travel to Poznan University of Technology to study Mechanical Engineering

data.name: section1_title
data.value: The Programme

data.name: section2_content1
data.value: Igor Sikorsky KPI - One of the biggest Universities in Europe, found on 1896 November 25. Comprises of 19 faculties, 9 educational and scientific institutes, several scientific and research institutes and educational centers. It trains 25000 students, postgraduates, doctorates as well as foreign student from neighbouring and far abroad countries.

data.name: section2_content2
data.value: Mechanical Engineering Institute - The partner of Double Master's Degree Programme

data.name: section2_content3
data.value: Together with Chemical-Technological is considered the oldest department in the University

data.name: section2_content4
data.value:
• Students - 1228
  • Chairs - 8
  • Scientific Subdivisions - 4
  • Specialities - 2
  • Specializations - 15

data.name: section2_content5
data.value: Chairs of Mechanical Engineering Institute

data.name: section2_title
data.value: National Technical University of Ukraine "Igor Sikorsky Kyiv Polytechnic Institute"

data.name: section3_content1
data.value: Poznan University of technology - The best Polish Technical University, founded in 1919. It is a place for 20 000 students, PhD's, DSc's study on 10 faculties 100 specializations in 27 branches of science

data.name: section3_content2
data.value: Faculty of Mechanical Engineering and Management - The partner of Double Master's Degree Programme

data.name: section3_content3
data.value: The oldest Faculty of Poznan University of Technology. It was at the roots of higher education in technical subjects in Wielkopolska Region. Currently, the Faculty consists of 4 institutes with 13 divisions and 1 chair.

data.name: section3_content4
data.value: Fields of study:

data.name: section3_content5
data.value:
• Biomedical Engineering
  • Materials Engineering
  • Mechanical Engineering
  • Mechatronics
  • Management and Production Engineering

data.name: section3_content6
data.value: Faculty of Machines and Transport - The partner of Double Master's Degree Programme

data.name: section3_content7
data.value: The Faculty was established on 1 October 1953. Comprises of 2 Institutes and 3 Chairs.

data.name: section3_content8
data.value: Fields of study:

data.name: section3_content9
data.value:
• Mechanical Engineering
  • Transport
  • Aerospace Engineering

data.name: section3_title
data.value: Poznan University of Technology

data.name: section4_step10_content2
data.value: Obtain two diplomas:

data.name: section4_step10_content3

data.name: section4_step10_title
data.value: Step 10. Defence of Master's Thesis

data.name: section4_step1_content
data.value:
A successful candidate for Double Master's Degree Programme must satisfy the following requirements:
  1. Must have diploma of 1st cycle of studies in Mechanical Engineering (Bachelor)
  2. Be enrolled in the Master’s programme (second cycle)
  3. Obtained B2 certificate of respective Language (English/Ukrainian/Polish)
  4. Be appointed to a Supervisor – from the home University
  5. Have a topic for Master’s thesis (approved by Reviewer)

data.name: section4_step1_title
data.value: Step 1. Requirements for Candidates

data.name: section4_step2_content1
data.value: Start with the

data.name: section4_step2_content2
data.value: Web Application Form

data.name: section4_step2_content3
data.value: provided on this website

data.name: section4_step2_content4
data.value: Aplicant should provide a DD Programme Coordinator of the home University with the following:

data.name: section4_step2_content5
data.value:
1. Application Form (signed by hand)
  2. Topic of master’s thesis
  3. Information about a Scientific Supervisor (Reviewer) (scientific degree, academic title, name, phone, e-mail)
  4. Bachelor's degree diploma scan (first cycle)
  5. Scan of Supplement to Diploma (transcript of records)

data.name: section4_step2_title
data.value: Step 2. Student’s admission to the DD Programme

data.name: section4_step3_content1
data.value:
• A candidate is to be selected on the competitive basis of the home University and fulfil the requirements of the admission board of the faculty.
  • All students will be informed of the selection results by the Coordinator of the Programme

data.name: section4_step3_title
data.value: Step 3. Assesment in home University (Candidates selection)

data.name: section4_step4_content1
data.value: A formal procedure of a selected candidate requires his registration in the on-line system

data.name: section4_step4_content2
data.value: , filling in on-line application form and uploading following documents:

data.name: section4_step4_content3
data.value:
• Application Form
  • Passport scan
  • CV (optional)
  • Bachelor's degree diploma scan (first cycle) translated into English or Polish language (if the language of document is different one)
  • Bachelors' diploma - a photocopy legalized at the Polish Embassy/Consulate or Apostilled (for the moment of arrival to PUT)
  • Scan of Supplement to Diploma (transcript of records), translated into English or Polish language (if the language of document is different one)
  • Scan of corresponding B2 Language certificate
  • Recommendation from the graduate’s department (optional)

data.name: section4_step4_content4
data.value: A registration of a student to partner University (on-line system

data.name: section4_step4_content5
data.value: should be not later than the end of the 1st semester.

data.name: section4_step4_title
data.value: Step 4. Registration in KSANTYPA

data.name: section4_step5_content1
data.value: On the basis of received documents the host University will:

data.name: section4_step5_content2
data.value:
• Verify the application documents
  • Register a candidate for the DD Programme
  • Provide a candidate for DD Programme with:
    • Invitation to study document
    • Contacts of faculty coordinator who is in charge of educational process
    • Together with the faculty coordinator appoints a Scientific Supervisor for Master thesis
    • List of subjects to cover the educational requirements
    • Agree the living conditions with the host University

data.name: section4_step5_title
data.value: Step 5. Assesment in the host University

data.name: section4_step6_content1
data.value: After assessment in home and host Universities and recieving list of subjects, student must:

data.name: section4_step6_content2
data.value:
• Fill-in (and send to the DD coordination center) the Learning Agreement with disciplines according to specified direction, approved by both institutions, with a detailed description of the syllabuses and competences to be acquired during a specified academic course, transcript of records from last semester(s) in home University, dates of arrival to- and departure from- the host University
  • Contact with scientific Supervisor from host University
  • Apply for Visa in Embassy
  • Obtain document of medical examination

data.name: section4_step6_title
data.value: Step 6. After assessment in home and host Universities

data.name: section4_step7_content1
data.value: Requirements for all students who are willing to study abroad:

data.name: section4_step7_content2
data.value: Apply for study at the

data.name: section4_step7_content3
data.value: Academic Mobility Department

data.name: section4_step7_content4
data.value:
• Approve individual Curriculum at the home Faculty (with end dates for passing the exams)
  • Approve the dates of departure and arrival to the home University

data.name: section4_step7_title
data.value: Step 7. Registration at the Students Mobility Office

data.name: section4_step8_content1
data.value: (Regulations 2.8) For enrolled students: Host institutions must provide pertinent pre-arrival information to students including information regarding travel and entry, costs likely to be incurred, and any other information which will assist students to prepare for their stay at the host institution.

data.name: section4_step8_content2
data.value: (Regulations 2.8) Student’s arrival to the host University: Host institution arranges and conducts a comprehensive on-site orientation program.

data.name: section4_step8_content3
data.value: By the end of studies in partner University students obtain transcript of records

data.name: section4_step8_title
data.value: Step 8. Travel and Study in partner University

data.name: section4_step9_content1
data.value:
• Make sure to return to home University before the end date approved in documents before the departure.
  • Contact your Coordinator about the arrival

data.name: section4_step9_content2
data.value: Provide necessary documents to Dean's office and

data.name: section4_step9_content3
data.value: Academic Mobility Department

data.name: section4_step9_title
data.value: Step 9. Return to home University

data.name: section4_title
data.value: How Does The Programme Work ?

data.name: Title
data.value: About

data.name: section2_content6
data.value:
• Machine Dynamics and Strength of Materials
  • Mechanics of Material Plasticity and Resource Saving Processes
  • Applied Hydro-Aeromechanics and Mechatronics
  • Applied Mechanics
  • Design of Machine Tools and Machines
  • Integrated Mechanical Engineering
  • Laser Systems and Physical Technologies
  • Manufacturing Engineering
